div.p: Most illustrious man, I write far less often than I would like; but this is due to the scarcity of messengers. I write now because a messenger from Schaffhausen has presented himself. I am in good health, by the grace of God, and I work in my usual manner. I have translated Brentius's book against the Asotus, and it is almost printed. If only you understood Italian; for I have added not a few things, but with the author's consent. I will depart from here next week, as I hope, to be partly in Stuttgart, partly in a certain town called Bachen, where Lord Gribaldus teaches.

Germany would be well off regarding religion, if not for the Schwenckfeldians on one side and bitter zeal concerning the Eucharistic article on the other, tearing it apart; may the Lord grant peace to His churches. There will certainly be a diet in March in Regensburg for the expedition against the Turks to be undertaken; for already, although it is winter, they are making incursions into Hungary. Within eight days we are to have a meeting of the entire Swabian circle here in Reutlingen. Our prince came today to the nearby village to hunt, while waiting for the appointed day for business. I was with him for a while; an enemy has poured many things into his ears about Calvin, against whom I certainly see not a few adversaries from all sides.

If by chance an image from Bern comes from Matthias Apiarius, ensure it reaches our Ruger in Schaffhausen; if it has not yet been sent, urge Haller to press Apiarius, who has already received the payment. I send some images with a German inscription; with this game, I play, when I must rest from more serious studies. I bid greetings to Lord Gualter and your sons-in-law and the other brothers. Help me with your prayers, which I earnestly ask of you. Reutlingen, December 6, 1555.
In this meeting, it will be discussed how Swabia is prepared with infantry, cavalry, artillery, etc., if there should be a need to fight. This is the main point.
(A. H.) To the most illustrious man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of the Church of Zürich, honorable brother. In Zürich.
